alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 28 at 4:50PM MST until December 30 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, East Platte County, Central Carbon County, Upper North Platte River Basin, Laramie Valley, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Patchy to areas of blowing snow from recent snowfall could reduce visibility to less than a half mile at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
